'Asafoetida' or 'asafetida' ('Ferula assa-foetida') (), [[Oxford English
Dictionary]]. "asafÅtida". Second edition, 1989. is the dried latex (gum
oleoresin) exuded from the living underground rhizome or tap root of several
species of [[Ferula]], which is a perennial herb (1 to 1.5 m high). The species
is native to the mountains of Afghanistan, and is mainly cultivated in nearby
India. http://www.indianspices.com/html/s062hasf.htm Asafoetida has a
pungent, unpleasant smell when raw, but in cooked dishes, it delivers a smooth
flavor, reminiscent of leeks.

It is also known as asant, food of the gods, giant fennel, jowani badian,
stinking gum, Devil's dung, hing and ting.
